title: Network Authors
text:
Adding New Authors
To add a new author to this network publication list:

Ensure they have an ORCID profile with their publications listed
Add their ORCID iD to the orcid_ids vector in R/fetch_orcid_publications.R
The publication list will update automatically on the next scheduled run


Data sourced from ORCID. Last updated: 2026-02-06 17:39:10 UTC

title: About
text: This website automatically aggregates and displays publications from members of the College of MVLS Learning Teaching and Scholarship network. Rather than manually maintaining a list that quickly becomes outdated, we leverage the ORCID infrastructure to keep our publication list current.

title: About
text: This website automatically aggregates and displays publications from members of the College of MVLS Learning Teaching and Scholarship network. Rather than manually maintaining a list that quickly becomes outdated, we leverage the ORCID infrastructure to keep our publication list current.

title: About
text:
How It Works





flowchart LR
    A[ORCID Profiles] -->|Weekly fetch| B[R Script]
    B --> C[SoTL Classification]
    C --> D[JSON Data File]
    D --> E[Quarto Website]
    E -->|GitHub Actions| F[GitHub Pages]







Data Source: Each network member maintains their own ORCID profile with their publications
Automated Fetching: A weekly GitHub Actions workflow runs an R script that queries the ORCID public API
Deduplication: Publications that appear on multiple authors’ profiles (collaborations) are deduplicated by DOI
SoTL Classification: Publications are automatically tagged as education-related based on journal names and title keywords
Website Generation: Quarto renders the data into a searchable, browsable website
Deployment: The site is automatically deployed to GitHub Pages

title: About
text:
SoTL Classification
Publications are automatically classified as Scholarship of Teaching and Learning (SoTL) or education-related using two methods:

Journal Matching
Publications appearing in known education journals are automatically tagged. The list includes journals across higher education, medical education, science education, and discipline-specific pedagogy journals.


Keyword Matching
For publications not matched by journal, titles are scanned for education-related terms such as “teaching”, “learning”, “pedagogy”, “curriculum”, “assessment”, “student”, and many others.
This classification is imperfect but provides a useful filter without requiring manual curation. The keyword and journal lists can be expanded by editing R/fetch_orcid_publications.R.

title: About
text:
Limitations

Only ORCID-indexed publications: Works not added to ORCID profiles won’t appear
Metadata quality varies: Publication details depend on how they were entered in ORCID
Weekly updates: There’s up to a 7-day delay between ORCID updates and website updates
No full-text: We only display metadata, not full papers

title: About
text:
Source Code
The complete source code for this website is available on GitHub. Feel free to fork and adapt for your own network.

title: MVLS LTS Network Outputs
text:
This website provides an automatically updated list of outputs from the College of MVLS Learning Teaching and Scholarship network at the University of Glasgow. Publication data is sourced directly from ORCID profiles and updated weekly via GitHub Actions.

title: MVLS LTS Network Outputs
text:
Recent SoTL Publications
Publications are automatically classified based on journal name and keywords to identify those related to the Scholarship of Teaching and Learning (SoTL) and those that are likely to be discipline-specific, so errors may occur.

Jayne Orr [School of Biodiversity One Health and Veterinary Medicine]; Monika Mihm Carmichael [School of Biodiversity, One Health and Veterinary Medicine]. Clinical‐year veterinary students are most likely to be confident and competent in calving procedures after blending simulator practicals with videos (2026). Veterinary Record.
Emily Nordmann [School of Psychology and Neuroscience]. Lecture capture as Universal Design for Learning: a post-pandemic scoping review (2026). Current Opinion in Physiology.
Anna McGregor [School of Biodiversity, One Health and Veterinary Medicine]; Leighann Sherry [School of Infection & Immunity]. LinkedIn to Get In: embedding learning activities to support student career development through online professional networking (2026). Access Microbiology.
Susan Lindsay [MVLS Graduate School]. Perspective on use of debate as pedagogical practice: a framework to teach and assess learning of contentious materials (2026). Frontiers in Education.
Lindsey Pope [School of Health and Wellbeing]. Preparing Students to Care for Socially Excluded Patients: A Qualitative Study of Inclusion Health in Undergraduate Medical Education (2026). The Clinical Teacher.
Eileen Cowey [School of Medicine Dentistry and Nursing]. Undergraduate nursing students’ competence in evidence-based practice and associated barriers and facilitators in Arab countries: A systematised review (2026). Next Research.
Lauren Headland [School of Molecular Biosciences]. A manifesto for plant science education (2025). PLANTS, PEOPLE, PLANET.
Dimitar Karadzhov [School of Health & Wellbeing]. Advancing Competency Development in Global Mental Health: A Call for Contextualised, Collaborative and Future-Oriented Approaches (2025). Mental Health Open.
Shaun Bremner-Hart [School of Molecular Biosciences]. Assessment of distinct effects of Parinari curatellifolia Planch.ex Benth Ethanolic leaf extract on glucose transport in different cell types (2025). PeerJ.
Alexia Revueltas Roux [School of Psychology and Neuroscience]. Challenges of translational education research: Teachers’ interpretations of embodied learning (2025). Cogent Education.
